body_html:
@arrufat : I'd encourage use of tensorflow/c/c_api.h. Either can be made to work, but for consistency with the examples we've been putting out and other source code (e.g., how we distribute the tarballs and where other language bindings expect it to be), I'd lean towards tensorflow/c/c_api.h.

Hope that helps.
body_text:
@arrufat : I'd encourage use of tensorflow/c/c_api.h. Either can be made to work, but for consistency with the examples we've been putting out and other source code (e.g., how we distribute the tarballs and where other language bindings expect it to be), I'd lean towards tensorflow/c/c_api.h.
Hope that helps.
body:
@arrufat : I'd encourage use of `tensorflow/c/c_api.h`. Either can be made to work, but for consistency with the examples we've been putting out and other source code (e.g., how we distribute the tarballs and where other language bindings expect it to be), I'd lean towards `tensorflow/c/c_api.h`.

Hope that helps.
